column5: Hi parents. I am a 15 year old girl, I get good grades, Iâ€™m very responsible and Iâ€™ve worked with kids in the past. I want to become a babysitter on the weekends. Would you hire me if you saw an ad of mine?

My main problem with getting a job would be transportation. My mom and dad both work until 5 or 6 every night. I donâ€™t know if I would be able to find a job where I could work with those hours. I donâ€™t even know if my parents would be willing to bring me.

This has happened to me before. My dad really didnâ€™t understand what I was going through. I ended up reaching out to the suicide hotline for my area and that turned into a whole big thing too. Even after the fact my dad still tried to make it about him when we saw my therapist as a family. Parents suck sometimes and really just donâ€™t get it and for whatever reason wonâ€™t just listen. Itâ€™s the worst feeling in the world to have your pain compared to other peopleâ€™s pain. The truth is your pain could be and probably is as bad as theirs. Just because you have something they donâ€™t doesnâ€™t mean your life is automatically going to be better or mean that you will be happy. I understand what youâ€™re going through and definitely do not think it is any less valid than anyone elseâ€™s hardships. You will get through this chapter in your life and be able to help others in the future. I believe in you. Best of luck
